djangotailoring.surveys.views.base¶

Background¶

Survey View classes have a lot of complicated methods that are designed to be easily overridden and allow you to keep your mitts off of the nasty bits of survey rendering and error handling.

Each Survey View is responsible for handling all of the pages for a particular Survey. Each request made to the view should have some way of communicating which page the user is on, and which user is requesting the page.

By default, the values are derived as follows:

  • The page is identified by a unique MTS Message ID of an element within the page, which is derived from a URL/Request parameter page_id.
  • The user is identified by the djangotailoring.subjects.SubjectLoader-compatible ID returned by BaseSurveyView.get_user_id().

Exceptions¶

exception djangotailoring.surveys.views.base.PageNotFound¶

Raised by Survey View classes when the requested Page is not found in the current Survey document structure.

exception djangotailoring.surveys.views.base.StateNotFound¶

Raised by Survey View classes when no state is found for the page/user pair.

BaseSurveyView Class¶

Attributes¶

class djangotailoring.surveys.views.base.BaseSurveyView¶

A subclass of django.views.generic.base.TemplateView that will render a template with a survey ‘chunk’ per the request’s user and page pair.

survey_manager = None

A reference to a surveytracking.classes.SurveyManager object. This is accessed by way of get_survey_manager().

survey_id = None

A unique name of the current survey used when serializing State objects. This is accessed by way of get_survey_id().

context_chunk_name = 'chunk'

The name of the djangotailoring.surveys.render.SurveyRenderChunk instance passed to the rendering context.

Attribute Getters¶

BaseSurveyView.get_survey_id(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:a unique identifier for the survey which is used to distinguish it from other surveys in the State serialization structure.

By default, this returns survey_id.

BaseSurveyView.get_user_id(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:a user id which is used to locate the appropriate State for the current request. It should be compatible with a djangotailoring.subjects.SubjectLoader.

required This method must be overridden.

BaseSurveyView.get_survey_manager(self)¶
Return type:a surveytracking.classes.SurveyManager instance
Returns:the active survey manager to handle page transitions and other survey mechanics.

By default, this returns survey_manager.

BaseSurveyView.get_project(self)¶
Return type:a tailoring2.project.BasicProject instance
Returns:the current Project instance.

By default, this is the current survey manager’s project.

BaseSurveyView.get_subject(self)¶
Return type:a tailoring2.subjects.Subject instance
Returns:the current subject being used for the survey.

required This method must be overridden.

The subject does not need to be constantly updated with the responses from the survey, since those are automatically combined with the running survey data loaded from the current survey state in get_request_subject().

BaseSurveyView.get_request_subject(self)¶
Return type:a tuple of (a tailoring2.subjects.Subject instance, a list of subject generation errors)
Returns:the current subject with all of the survey response data up to the current page of the survey, along with any errors in generating that subject.

The subject is based on the current state data, and the subject returned by get_subject(). A new subject is created, so no damage is done to either the request data, or the subject returned from get_subject().

BaseSurveyView.get_tailoring_request(self)¶
Return type:a djangotailoring.tailoringrequest.TailoringRequest instance
Returns:a TailoringRequest instance that will be modified to suit the current survey request’s needs.

By default, it returns an empty TailoringRequest instance.

BaseSurveyView.get_active_source(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:the name of the source that data is inserted to.

By default, it checks the TailoringRequest returned by get_tailoring_request() for a default_source value. If that doesn’t exist, it returns the source of the current survey manager.

BaseSurveyView.get_current_page(self)¶
Return type:a surveytracking.classes.Page instance
Returns:the page for the current request.

Traversal Handlers¶

BaseSurveyView.can_pass_page(self[, subject=None])¶
Parameters:subject (a tailoring2.subjects.Subject instance) – the subject to test against.
Return type:a boolean
Returns:whether subject can advance beyond the current page.

A user can pass the page if there are no validation errors on the current page. If there are no previous errors, and there are any loose validation errors, a user cannot pass the current page.

If subject is None, then it will test with the subject made with get_request_subject().

BaseSurveyView.get_render_chunk(self[, show_errors=None])¶
Return type:SurveyRenderChunk instance
Returns:the chunk that is passed to the template context for the current request.

Navigation Handlers¶

BaseSurveyView.get_base_url(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:the absolute URL to this survey view, with the page_id stubbed out as the string-formatting parameter ‘%s’.

This is used to build URLs for redirects within the current survey view.

BaseSurveyView.url_for_page_id(self, page_id)¶
Parameters:page_id – the ID for the page you wish to have the URL for
Type :a string
Return type:a string
Returns:the absolute URL to the passed survey page.
BaseSurveyView.get_previous_url(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:the absolute URL to the previous survey page.
BaseSurveyView.redirect(self, page=None, page_id=None)¶
Parameters:
  • page (a surveytracking.classes.Page insance) – the page you wish to redirect to
  • page_id (a string) – the ID of the page you wish to redirect to
Return type:

a django.http.HttpResponse
Returns:

a response that temporarily redirects the user to the requested page.

Request Data Conversion¶

BaseSurveyView.get_request_data(self)¶
Return type:a django.http.QueryDict instance
Returns:the Query dictionary to search for survey data.

By default, this returns self.request.POST.

BaseSurveyView.get_request_survey_data(self)¶
Return type:a tuple of (dictionary, list of errors)
Returns:a converted set of survey answers found in the request data.

This method packs a serious punch. All data in the QueryDict returned by get_request_data() is sifted through and coercion from string to MTS Dictionary type is attempted. Any errors found during that conversion are caught and inserted into the list of errors returned as well.

View Handlers¶

BaseSurveyView.can_access_survey(self)¶
Return type:a boolean
Returns:whether the user requesting the current page should be allowed to access the current survey.

If this is false, the view will return the result of handle_bad_page_request() is given to the client.

Returns True by default.

BaseSurveyView.handle_bad_page_request(self)¶
Return type:a django.http.HttpResponse instance
Returns:a response that indicates that a page is inaccessible.

Returns a “403 Forbidden” response by default.

BaseSurveyView.handle_end_of_survey(self)¶
Return type:a django.http.HttpResponse instance
Returns:a response that indicates that the survey has been completed, such as redirecting to an acknowledgement page.

Redirects a user to the root page of the site (/) by default.

BaseSurveyView.on_successful_page_request(self)¶

Once a request is determined to be for a known page with a known State, this method is called.

There is no default implementation.

BaseSurveyView.on_valid_submission(self)¶

Once a POST request is determined to be free of validation errors, this method is called.

There is no default implementation.

BaseSurveyView.on_invalid_submission(self)¶

If a POST request is determined to have one or more validation errors, this method is called.

There is no default implementation.

State handlers¶

BaseSurveyView.get_current_state(self)¶
BaseSurveyView.get_latest_state(self)¶
BaseSurveyView.create_next_state(self, next_page)¶
BaseSurveyView.create_initial_state(self)¶
BaseSurveyView.state_subject_data(self, state)¶
BaseSurveyView.state_has_validation_errors(self, state)¶
BaseSurveyView.on_validation_error(self, state)¶
BaseSurveyView.get_previous_page(self, state)¶
BaseSurveyView.redirect_to_state(self, state)¶
BaseSurveyView.set_state_request_data(self, state, data)¶
BaseSurveyView.save_state(self, state)¶
BaseSurveyView.state_for_restart(self)¶

SimpleSurveyView Class¶

class djangotailoring.surveys.views.base.SimpleSurveyView¶

Subclass of BaseSurveyView to create a self-contained Survey view for a specified Survey Document and source.

survey_document¶

A path to an MTS survey, optionally relative to the current project.

source¶

A string representing the name of the source that survey data will be stored.

SinglePageSurveyView Class¶

class djangotailoring.surveys.views.base.SinglePageSurveyView¶

Subclass of BaseSurveyView to build a view that assumes that the Survey document consists of a single page. This removes the requirement that the view have a page_id keyword argument. Attributes operate the same as SimpleSurveyView as it also derives from NoManagerMixin.

Mixins¶

class djangotailoring.surveys.views.base.AutoSaveSubjectDataMixin¶

Calls save_subject when a user submits a valid request on a survey page.

class djangotailoring.surveys.views.base.NoManagerMixin¶

Automatically creates a SurveyManager based on two parameters for use in a SurveyView. Simplifies the creation of a survey view down to a single subclass with class attributes rather than having to create a manager out-of-band.

survey_document = None

A path to an MTS survey, optionally relative to the current project. This is accessed by way of get_survey_document().

source = None

A string representing the name of the source that survey data will be stored. This is accessed by way of get_source().

get_survey_document(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:a path to an MTS sruvey document.

By default, this returns survey_document.

get_source(self)¶
Return type:a string
Returns:a string identifying the active source for the survey.

By default, this returns source.
